Design.comm: The kettle has a beautiful design.

cont.entity_a: Design features like the power plug and lid are well thought out. The kettle is stylish with a manageable cord. The kettle is ergonomic and has a clean pour.
Good performance initially. The kettle boils water quickly and has a convenient auto shut-off.
cont.entity_b: Heats water quickly and efficiently. Boils water faster than a stovetop. Auto shut-off takes longer than expected.

Material.comm: Plastic parts are prone to breaking.

cont.entity_a: Plastic parts crack easily, indicating a material problem. Breville kettles have a plasticky smell that affects the boiled water. Plastic parts in contact with hot water are a concern. Frequent issue with the plastic trim cracking and breaking.
cont.entity_b: Has a plastic connector to the water meter. Seamless stainless steel lining prevents plastic taste.

cont.entity_a: New models have a shorter lifespan and quality issues. Durability is questionable, with issues like broken buttons and leaking. Long-term reliability is inconsistent across different units. Kettles often fail to last as long as expected for the price.
cont.entity_b: Quality has declined since 2016 with issues like lid not closing. Some units last years.
Cleaning lime buildup is easy with vinegar. Large opening makes cleaning easy. Lid doesn't open wide enough for easy cleaning. Wide mouth is convenient for various uses.
Auto-off function is unreliable, posing a safety risk. Steam escapes from hinge, causing burns.

cont.entity_a: High-quality appearance but prone to rust and mineral deposits. Some users report rusting on stainless steel parts.
Previous cheaper brand lasted longer without issues. Amazon version differs in features like the water gauge compared to BedBath version.

cont.entity_b: Capacity is large and easy to fill.
The kettle is efficient but may spill when pouring.
